title: Taurus Compatibility: What's the Best Sign for a Taurus to Date?

steps.title: Taurus:
steps.content: Taurus: Venus, the planet of love, reigns supreme over Taurus—so, a bull-on-bull relationship is quite literally a match made in heaven! Taureans appreciate the simple pleasures in life and long for a classic, traditional romance straight out of the movies. Even though Tauruses are known for being on the stubborn side, it’s hard to run into conflict when you and your partner are always on the same page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Virgo:
steps.content: Virgo: As a fellow earth sign, Taurus finds a great sense of comfort in the grounded, steady nature of a Virgo. Plus, the perfectionist Virgo loves knowing that they can always depend on the reliable Taurus for anything and everything. [2] X Research source Virgos like honesty, availability, and cleanliness. They’ll get plenty of that with a Taurus!

steps.title: Capricorn:
steps.content: Capricorn: Capricorn and Taurus are yet another great example of earth signs melding super well together. The sensual, dependable Taurus encourages the Capricorn to break loose and have some fun, while the hard-working, focused Capricorn helps Taurus expand their horizons and reach for the stars. It’s no wonder that the goat and bull of the zodiac like to graze in the same pasture!

steps.title: Cancer:
steps.content: Cancer: Cancer and Taurus are 2 of the most nurturing signs of the zodiac. The caring, sensitive crab and the grounded, family-loving bull both crave a domestic, comfortable life that’s full of never-ending support. Does it get any better than that?

steps.title: Scorpio:
steps.content: Scorpio: Water and earth signs are very compatible together, and a Taurus-Scorpio relationship is no exception. [3] X Research source Although the scorpion and the bull fall on completely opposite ends of the zodiac wheel, they have lots in common, like approaching life with a special intensity. Plus, they both prioritize loyalty more than the average sign, which makes for a steady, long-term relationship. Reader Poll: We asked 379 wikiHow readers to tell us the quality they value most in a partner and 49% of them said loyalty and dependability . [Take Poll] So it’s a great sign that Taurus and Scorpio have such a strong potential for loyalty!

steps.title: Pisces:
steps.content: Pisces: Pisceans and Taureans just click—that’s all there is to it. They’re both deeply connected to the 5 senses and complement each other well overall. The kind, empathetic nature of a Pisces helps remind Taurus that it’s okay to defy gravity and poke your head up in the clouds—a reminder that the stubborn bull often needs.

steps.title: Libra:
steps.content: Libra: A Libra-Taurus relationship is a classic example of the head vs. the heart. Libras tend to think everything through, while a Taurus usually follows their heart. These contrasting viewpoints and perspectives can make for an interesting relationship, though both signs could benefit from a little extra communication to stay on the same page.

steps.title: Leo:
steps.content: Leo: These two signs can make a dynamic duo, but their stubborn instincts may lead to an impasse down the road. A willingness to meet in the middle can go a long way with these two signs, and can help smooth things out.

steps.title: Gemini:
steps.content: Gemini: Tauruses and Geminis approach life with a similar sense of joy and adventure, which can make this relationship a lot of fun. Still, the grounded Taurus might have some trouble keeping up with free-spirited Gemini. It’s nothing an open dialogue and a little compromise can’t solve, though!

steps.title: Aquarius:
steps.content: Aquarius: The average Aquarius approaches life independently, and likes to do things in a variety of different ways. The stable, grounded Taurus may have some trouble vibing with this lifestyle at first, but that doesn’t mean this relationship is out of the question! A Taurus-Aquarius pairing can work out as long as both people take strides to stay on the same page.

steps.title: Sagittarius:
steps.content: Sagittarius: A Taurus wants nothing more than to plant roots and spend a domestic life with their partner, while a Sagittarius wants nothing more than a nomadic, adventurous, and untethered existence. That’s not to say that this pairing is totally star-crossed—but both partners will have to communicate freely and honestly to make sure they want the same things overall. Sagittariuses have a real need for freedom and space. For this relationship to work out, Taurus needs to be wiling to give their partner some extra breathing room.

steps.title: Aries:
steps.content: Aries: The bold, headstrong ram tends to charge right into action, while the stubborn, grounded bull prefers to stay rooted in place. There’s no denying that these signs go through life at completely different speeds, so open communication and compromise are a must if you want this relationship to work out.

steps.title: Appeal to their senses.
steps.content: Appeal to their senses. Tauruses are extremely rooted in the 5 senses and appreciate any gesture that caters to them. Take an afternoon to whip up their favorite dessert, surprise them with a soft, luxurious blanket, or make them a special playlist they can fall asleep to. The Taurus in your life will definitely appreciate it! [4] X Research source You could also: Wear a scented perfume that your Taurus loves Give them a gorgeous painting to hang up in their bedroom Offer them a big hug Give them a nice massage

steps.title: Put lots of effort into your next date.
steps.content: Put lots of effort into your next date. Flower bouquets, chocolates, candlelit dinners—any and all romantic gestures will score you points with a Taurus. It’s okay if you aren’t the most romantic person in the world; at the end of the day, it’s the thought that counts. Your Taurus will appreciate the time and thought you put into making them feel special.

steps.title: Be patient with them.
steps.content: Be patient with them. For better or for worse, Tauruses march to the beat of their own drum. Try not to rush them into making decisions, and give them as much time as they need to make a decision or come to an opinion about something. Keep in mind that Taurus is considered a “fixed” sign in the zodiac—it’s hard to get a fixed bull to move unless it really wants to.

steps.title: Make time for communication.
steps.content: Make time for communication. It can be tough to manage a relationship when both partners are tuned into completely different frequencies. A Taurus and their SO can easily boost their compatibility just by being open and honest about what they want and expect out of the relationship.

steps.title: Compromise if the situation calls for it.
steps.content: Compromise if the situation calls for it. Disagreements are inevitable in any relationship, but a Taurus may often find themselves at odds with free-spirited signs like Aquarius and Sagittarius. Being willing to meet in the middle is a great way to sidestep potential disagreements and conflicts while keeping both partners happy. If a Sagittarius wants to go on a week-long trip, the Taurus could suggest going on a weekend excursion instead. If Aries wants to go to a last-minute concert, Taurus might suggest booking tickets for a concert a few weeks in the future.
